variant.question:

options.text: None, the reason for the change is that the air over Palma is warmer than the air over Marseille
Compensate by heading further to the left
Have your altimeter checked, because its readings are obviously wrong

variant.question: How does cold air advection affect the true vertical distance between flight levels?

options.text: The advection of cold air means advection of denser air, thus the distance between the flight levels is reduced.
The advection of cold air means advection of heavier air, so the distance between two flight levels increases.
The accelerated air-flow lowers the pressure (Bernoulli-effect), thus the distance between the flight levels is reduced.
The true distance between flight levels is defined by standard regulations and does not depend on the weather conditions.
